docs.title: MATRIX Data Model Documentation
docs.text:
The collected MATRIX schemas

Schema PURL: https://w3id.org/everycure-org/matrix-schema

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: Here, you can find the collected documentation of all public data products created by the Matrix project. This includes the schemas for our KG products and the disease list.

docs.title: Classes
docs.text: Class Description DiseaseListEntry A disease entry in the disease list. MatrixDiseaseList A list of diseases. MatrixEdge An edge representing a relationship between two nodes in the Biolink knowledge graph. UnionedEdge An edge in the unioned everycure matrix graph. MatrixEdgeList A container for MatrixEdge objects. MatrixNode A node in the Biolink knowledge graph. UnionedNode A node in the unioned everycure matrix graph. MatrixNodeList A container for MatrixNode objects.

docs.title: Slots
docs.text: Name Description agent_type Type of agent involved in the relationship

docs.title: Schema Source
docs.text: • from schema: https://w3id.org/everycure-org/matrix-schema

docs.title: LinkML Source
docs.text:
name: AgentTypeEnum
from_schema: https://w3id.org/everycure-org/matrix-schema
rank: 1000
permissible_values:
  manual_agent:
    text: manual_agent
    description: A human agent who is responsible for generating a statement of knowledge.
      The human may utilize computationally generated information as evidence for
      the resulting knowledge,  but the human is the one who ultimately interprets/reasons
      with  this evidence to produce a statement of knowledge.
  automated_agent:
    text: automated_agent
    description: An automated agent, typically a software program or tool, that is  responsible
      for generating a statement of knowledge. Human contribution  to the knowledge
      creation process ends with the definition and coding of algorithms or analysis
      pipelines that get executed by the automated agent.
  data_analysis_pipeline:
    text: data_analysis_pipeline
    description: An automated agent that executes an analysis workflow over data and  reports
      the direct results of the analysis. These typically report  statistical associations/correlations
      between variables in the input dataset, and do not interpret/infer broader conclusions
      from associations the analysis reveals in the data.
    is_a: automated_agent
    notes:
    - If an analysis pipeline includes any rules for generating broader  conclusions
      based on the dataset-specific statistical correlations it calculates (e.g. create
      a 'treats' edge when the analysis reveals a  drug-disease correlation in the
      data with statistical scores that meet a  certain threshold) - we would consider
      this agent to be a Computational Model rather than just a Data Analysis Pipeline.
  computational_model:
    text: computational_model
    description: An automated agent that generates knowledge statements (typically
      predictions) based on rules/logic explicitly encoded in an algorithm (e.g. heuristic
      models, supervised classifiers), or learned from patterns  observed in data
      (e.g. ML models, unsupervised classifiers).
    is_a: automated_agent
    notes:
    - The bar is quite low relatively for what is considered to be a  ‘computational
      model’ by our definition. Even agents/tools that apply  simple rules or logic
      to the output of an ingest or analysis pipeline to allow for a stronger or more
      general conclusion to be stated can  qualify an agent as a model. For example,
      an ingest pipeline that applies rules to its ingest of  clinical trials data
      to create a 'treats' prediction edge when the  source reports a drug to be in
      phase 2 or 3 trials represents a computational model because it is automatically
      drawing a stronger conclusion than the source reports, based on logic encoded
      in the ingest pipeline. Similarly, a data analysis pipeline that is extended
      with rules to  automatically generate broader conclusions based on dataset-specific
      statistical correlations (e.g. create a 'treats' edge when the analysis reveals
      a drug-disease correlation in the data with statistical scores  that meet a
      certain threshold), would also qualify as a computational  model by our definition.
  text_mining_agent:
    text: text_mining_agent
    description: An automated agent that uses Natural Language Processing to recognize
      concepts and/or relationships in text, and report them using formally encoded
      semantics (e.g. as an edge in a knowledge graph).
    is_a: automated_agent
    notes:
    - The original statement in the source text is typically made by a human /  manual
      agent, but if a specific encoding of this knowledge is produced by a text-mining
      tool, it has an agent_type of 'text_mining_agent'. Examples of text mining agents
      include SemmedDB, and the Translator Text-Mining Knowledge Provider. Note that
      text-mining tools are prone to erroneous interpretation of  concepts and relationships,
      and can fail to provide important details  about the context in which the original
      knowledge was reported - so users should always consult the source text for
      a text-mined statement to assess its veracity and relevance.
  image_processing_agent:
    text: image_processing_agent
    description: An automated agent that processes images to generate textual statements
      of  knowledge derived from the image and/or expressed in text the image  depicts
      (e.g. via OCR).
    is_a: automated_agent
  manual_validation_of_automated_agent:
    text: manual_validation_of_automated_agent
    description: A human agent reviews and validates/approves the veracity of knowledge  that
      is initially generated by an automated agent.
    notes:
    - This term applies when a human was only involved in evaluating the veracity
      of a knowledge statement that was generated by an automated agent. It is  important
      to indicate when such manual review has occurred, because it can give a user
      more confidence in an automated statement.
  not_provided:
    text: not_provided
    description: The agent type is not provided, typically because it cannot be determined
      from available information if the agent that generated the knowledge is  manual
      or automated.

docs.title: Disease List Entry (schema class)
docs.text:
A disease entry in the disease list.

URI: matrix_schema:DiseaseListEntry

docs.title: Attributes
docs.text: Name Description Cardinality and Range category_class The disase identifier. Slot name should probably be renamed? 1  String label The name of the disease. 1  String definition The definition of the disease. 0..1  String synonyms Any exact synonyms of the disease. 1..*  String subsets The subsets of the disease in which it is part. 1..*  String crossreferences Cross-references to other databases and ontologies. 1..*  String is_matrix_manually_excluded Flag to denote this disease was manually excluded from the disease list by a Matrix medical expert. 1  Boolean is_matrix_manually_included Flag to denote this disease was manually included from the disease list by a Matrix medical expert. 1  Boolean is_clingen Flag to denote that this disease term is used directly by https://clinicalgenome.org/ (a major authority on genetic diseases), which is a strong indication that it corresponds to a real disease entity. 1  Boolean is_grouping_subset Flag to denote this disease is manually curated to be a grouping term. 1  Boolean is_grouping_subset_ancestor Flag to denote this disease is a parent of a disease that was manually curated to be a grouping term. 1  Boolean is_orphanet_subtype Flag to denote this disease is manually curated to be a disease subtype according to Orphanet (https://www.orpha.net/), one of the most important rare disease authorities in the world. 1  Boolean is_orphanet_subtype_descendant Flag to denote this disease is a child/descendant of a disease that is manually curated  to be a disease subtype according to Orphanet (https://www.orpha.net/), one of the most  important rare disease authorities in the world. If it is a descendant of a subtype, it most likely is a subtype itself. 1  Boolean is_omimps Flag to denote this disease is manually curated to be a phenotypic series according to OMIM (https://www.omim.org/),  one of the most important genetic disease authorities in the world.  A Phenotypic Series is a grouping of genetic heterogeneity of similar phenotypes across the genome. 1  Boolean is_omimps_descendant Flag to denote this disease is a child/descendant of a disease that is manually curated  to be a phenotypic series according to OMIM (https://www.omim.org/), one of the most  important genetic disease authorities in the world. If it is a descendant of a phenotypic series, it most likely is a proper genetic disease entity (or subtype). 1  Boolean is_leaf Flag to denote this disease is a leaf node in the disease hierarchy.  A leaf node is a node that has no children in the hierarchy. 1  Boolean is_leaf_direct_parent Flag to denote this disease is a direct parent of a leaf node in the disease hierarchy.  A direct parent of a leaf rarely corresponds to a grouping, and often is a proper disease entity. 1  Boolean is_orphanet_disorder Flag to denote this disease is manually curated to be a disease according to Orphanet (https://www.orpha.net/),  one of the most important rare disease authorities in the world.  A disorder according to Orphanet usually corresponds to a proper disease entity, not a grouping or a subtype. 1  Boolean is_omim Flag to denote this disease is manually curated to be a disease according to OMIM (https://www.omim.org/),  one of the most important genetic disease authorities in the world.  A disease according to OMIM usually corresponds to a proper disease entity or a subtype, not a disease grouping. 1  Boolean is_icd_category Flag to denote this disease was corresponds to an ICD category. Category codes (or subcategory codes), for example A01.1 (Paratyphoid fever A),  can be recognised by containing a period (.) character and usually represent specific  diagnosable diseases. 1  Boolean is_icd_chapter_code Flag to denote this disease was corresponds to an ICD chapter code. Chapter codes (or block codes), for example A00-B99 (Certain infectious and parasitic diseases).  These codes can be recognised by containing a dash (-) character, and usually represent broad categories of diseases. 1  Boolean is_icd_chapter_header Flag to denote this disease was corresponds to an ICD chapter header. Chapter headers (or chapter titles), for example A00 (Cholera) can be identified by codes without dashes or periods and are usually the top-level categories within each chapter. Most of the time, these are not proper diseases, but groupings of diseases. 1  Boolean is_icd_billable Flag to denote this disease was corresponds to an ICD code that is billable. Billable codes are usually the most specific codes that can be used for billing purposes, and are most of the time diagnosable diseases. 1  Boolean is_mondo_subtype Flag to denote this disease was identified to be a subtype through lexical matching. This method is maintained by the Every Cure medical team and the Disease List team. 1  Boolean is_pathway_defect Flag to denote this disease corresponds to a pathway defect rather than a proper disease. 1  Boolean is_susceptibility Flag to denote this disease corresponds to a susceptibility rather than a proper disease. 1  Boolean is_paraphilic Flag to denote this disease corresponds to a paraphilic disorder rather than a proper disease. 1  Boolean is_acquired Flag to denote this disease corresponds to an acquired form of a disease. 1  Boolean is_andor Flag to denote this disease corresponds to a disease that is a combination of two or more diseases. 1  Boolean is_withorwithout Flag to denote this disease corresponds to a disease that can be present with or without some other pathological condition. 1  Boolean is_obsoletion_candidate Flag to denote that this disease is marked for obsoletion in the (near) future. This status does not guarantee that the disease will be obsoleted, but it is a strong indication. 1  Boolean is_unclassified_hereditary Flag to denote that this disease has no descendants (is a leaf) and  is classified broadly as an hereditary disease, but lacks any further classification. 1  Boolean official_matrix_filter Flag to denote this disease corresponds to a disease that can be treated with small molecules or biologics. This flag is maintained as a combination of default filters by the Matrix team. Changes to this filter should be discussed on the Matrix disease list issue tracker (https://github.com/everycure-org/matrix-disease-list/issues). Warning. This flag is in early alpha state, and its use in production systems is not recommended. 1  Boolean harrisons_view Tag to denote this disease to be part of a grouping according to the Harrison's textbook. Top-level classes in Mondo are manually curated by the Mondo team to "belong" to a Harrison's textbook chapter. Disagreements should be reported on the Mondo issue tracker (https://github.com/monarch-initiative/mondo/issues). 1..*  String mondo_txgnn Tag to denote this disease to be part of a grouping as defined by the txgnn paper. Disease classes in Mondo are manually curated by the Mondo team to "belong" to a txgnn category. Disagreements should be reported on the Mondo issue  tracker (https://github.com/monarch-initiative/mondo/issues). 1..*  String mondo_top_grouping Tag to denote this disease to be a . Disease classes in Mondo are manually curated by the Mondo team to "belong" to a txgnn category. Disagreements should be reported on the Mondo issue  tracker (https://github.com/monarch-initiative/mondo/issues). 1..*  String medical_specialization Tag this disease with a medical specialisation. Disease classes are automatically tagged by an LLM. Problems/issues should be reported on the Matrix disease list issue  tracker (https://github.com/everycure-org/matrix-disease-list/issues). 1..*  String txgnn Tag this disease to be part of a grouping as defined by the txgnn paper. Disease classes in Mondo are automatically assigned to a txgnn category using an LLM. Problems/issues should be reported on the Matrix disease list issue  tracker (https://github.com/everycure-org/matrix-disease-list/issues). 1..*  String anatomical Tag to denote this disease to be part of a grouping according to the anatomical location. Disease terms are automatically tagged using an LLM. Problems/issues should be reported on the Matrix disease list issue  tracker (https://github.com/everycure-org/matrix-disease-list/issues). 1..*  String is_pathogen_caused Flag to denote if this disease is caused by a pathogen. Disease classes are automatically flagged using an LLM. Problems/issues should be reported on the Matrix disease list issue  tracker (https://github.com/everycure-org/matrix-disease-list/issues). 1  Boolean is_cancer Flag to denote if this disease corresponds to a cancer type. Disease classes are automatically flagged using an LLM. Problems/issues should be reported on the Matrix disease list issue  tracker (https://github.com/everycure-org/matrix-disease-list/issues). 1  Boolean is_glucose_dysfunction Flag to denote if this disease corresponds to a glucose dysfunction. Disease classes are automatically flagged using an LLM. tracker (https://github.com/everycure-org/matrix-disease-list/issues). 1  Boolean tag_existing_treatment Flag to denote if this disease has some existing treatment. Disease classes are automatically flagged using an LLM. Problems/issues should be reported on the Matrix disease list issue  tracker (https://github.com/everycure-org/matrix-disease-list/issues). 1  Boolean tag_qaly_lost Tag denoting the degree to which Quality-Adjusted Life Year (QALY) lost. Disease terms are automatically tagged using an LLM. Problems/issues should be reported on the Matrix disease list issue  tracker (https://github.com/everycure-org/matrix-disease-list/issues). 1  String subset_group_id The identifier of a disease representing the subtype series this disease belongs to. 0..1  String subset_group_label The name (label) of a disease representing the subtype series this disease belongs to. 0..1  String other_subsets_count The number of other subtypes in the subset this disease belongs to. 0..1  Integer

description: A disease entry in the disease list.

from_schema: https://w3id.org/everycure-org/matrix-schema
slot_usage:

    required: true

    name: is_icd_chapter_code
    required: true
  is_icd_chapter_header:
    name: is_icd_chapter_header
    required: true
  is_icd_billable:
    name: is_icd_billable
    required: true
  is_mondo_subtype:
    name: is_mondo_subtype
    required: true
  is_pathway_defect:
    name: is_pathway_defect
    required: true
  is_susceptibility:
    name: is_susceptibility
    required: true
  is_paraphilic:
    name: is_paraphilic
    required: true
  is_acquired:
    name: is_acquired
    required: true
  is_andor:
    name: is_andor
    required: true
  is_withorwithout:
    name: is_withorwithout
    required: true
  is_obsoletion_candidate:
    name: is_obsoletion_candidate
    required: true
  is_unclassified_hereditary:
    name: is_unclassified_hereditary
    required: true
  official_matrix_filter:
    name: official_matrix_filter
    required: true
  harrisons_view:
    name: harrisons_view
    required: true
  mondo_txgnn:
    name: mondo_txgnn
    required: true
  mondo_top_grouping:
    name: mondo_top_grouping
    required: true
  medical_specialization:
    name: medical_specialization
    required: true
  txgnn:
    name: txgnn
    required: true
  anatomical:
    name: anatomical
    required: true
  is_pathogen_caused:
    name: is_pathogen_caused
    required: true
  is_cancer:
    name: is_cancer
    required: true
  is_glucose_dysfunction:
    name: is_glucose_dysfunction
    required: true

    name: tag_existing_treatment
    required: true

    name: tag_qaly_lost
    required: true

    required: false
  subset_group_label:

  other_subsets_count:
    name: other_subsets_count
    required: false
attributes:
  category_class:
    name: category_class
    description: The disase identifier. Slot name should probably be renamed?
    from_schema: https://w3id.org/everycure-org/matrix-schema
    rank: 1000
    alias: category_class
    owner: DiseaseListEntry
    domain_of:
    - DiseaseListEntry
    range: string
    required: true
  label:
    name: label
    description: The name of the disease.
    from_schema: https://w3id.org/everycure-org/matrix-schema
    rank: 1000
    alias: label
    owner: DiseaseListEntry
    domain_of:
    - DiseaseListEntry
    range: string
    required: true
  definition:
    name: definition
    description: The definition of the disease.
    from_schema: https://w3id.org/everycure-org/matrix-schema
    rank: 1000
    alias: definition
    owner: DiseaseListEntry
    domain_of:
    - DiseaseListEntry
    range: string
    required: false
  synonyms:
    name: synonyms
    description: Any exact synonyms of the disease.
    from_schema: https://w3id.org/everycure-org/matrix-schema
    rank: 1000
    alias: synonyms
    owner: DiseaseListEntry
    domain_of:
    - DiseaseListEntry
    range: string
    required: true
    multivalued: true
    inlined: true
    inlined_as_list: true
  subsets:
    name: subsets
    description: The subsets of the disease in which it is part.
    from_schema: https://w3id.org/everycure-org/matrix-schema
    rank: 1000
    alias: subsets
    owner: DiseaseListEntry
    domain_of:
    - DiseaseListEntry
    range: string
    required: true
    multivalued: true
    inlined: true
    inlined_as_list: true
  crossreferences:
    name: crossreferences
    description: Cross-references to other databases and ontologies.
    from_schema: https://w3id.org/everycure-org/matrix-schema
    rank: 1000
    alias: crossreferences
    owner: DiseaseListEntry
    domain_of:
    - DiseaseListEntry
    range: string
    required: true
    multivalued: true
    inlined: true
    inlined_as_list: true
  is_matrix_manually_excluded:
    name: is_matrix_manually_excluded
    annotations:
      attribute_type:
        tag: attribute_type
        value: filter
      curation_type:
        tag: curation_type
        value: manual_everycure
    description: Flag to denote this disease was manually excluded from the disease
      list by a Matrix medical expert.
    from_schema: https://w3id.org/everycure-org/matrix-schema
    see_also:
    - https://github.com/everycure-org/matrix-disease-list/blob/main/src/excluded-diseases.robot.tsv
    rank: 1000
    alias: is_matrix_manually_excluded
    owner: DiseaseListEntry
    domain_of:
    - DiseaseListEntry
    range: boolean
    required: true
  is_matrix_manually_included:
    name: is_matrix_manually_included
    annotations:
      attribute_type:
        tag: attribute_type
        value: filter
      curation_type:
        tag: curation_type
        value: manual_everycure
    description: Flag to denote this disease was manually included from the disease
      list by a Matrix medical expert.
    from_schema: https://w3id.org/everycure-org/matrix-schema
    see_also:
    - https://github.com/everycure-org/matrix-disease-list/blob/main/src/included-diseases.robot.tsv
    rank: 1000
    alias: is_matrix_manually_included
    owner: DiseaseListEntry
    domain_of:
    - DiseaseListEntry
    range: boolean
    required: true
  is_clingen:
    name: is_clingen
    annotations:
      attribute_type:
        tag: attribute_type
        value: filter
      curation_type:
        tag: curation_type
        value: external_source
    description: Flag to denote that this disease term is used directly by https://clinicalgenome.org/
      (a major authority on genetic diseases), which is a strong indication that it
      corresponds to a real disease entity.
    from_schema: https://w3id.org/everycure-org/matrix-schema
    see_also:
    - https://github.com/everycure-org/matrix-disease-list/blob/main/sparql/matrix-disease-list-filters.sparql
    - https://clinicalgenome.org/
    rank: 1000
    alias: is_clingen
    owner: DiseaseListEntry
    domain_of:
    - DiseaseListEntry
    range: boolean
    required: true
  is_grouping_subset:
    name: is_grouping_subset
    annotations:
      attribute_type:
        tag: attribute_type
        value: filter
      curation_type:
        tag: curation_type
        value: manual_mondo
    description: Flag to denote this disease is manually curated to be a grouping
      term.
    from_schema: https://w3id.org/everycure-org/matrix-schema
    see_also:
    - https://github.com/everycure-org/matrix-disease-list/blob/main/sparql/matrix-disease-list-filters.sparql
    rank: 1000
    alias: is_grouping_subset
    owner: DiseaseListEntry
    domain_of:
    - DiseaseListEntry
    range: boolean
    required: true
  is_grouping_subset_ancestor:
    name: is_grouping_subset_ancestor
    annotations:
      attribute_type:
        tag: attribute_type
        value: filter
      curation_type:
        tag: curation_type
        value: ontology_hierarchy
    description: Flag to denote this disease is a parent of a disease that was manually
      curated to be a grouping term.
    from_schema: https://w3id.org/everycure-org/matrix-schema
    see_also:
    - https://github.com/everycure-org/matrix-disease-list/blob/main/sparql/matrix-disease-list-filters.sparql
    rank: 1000
    alias: is_grouping_subset_ancestor
    owner: DiseaseListEntry
    domain_of:
    - DiseaseListEntry
    range: boolean
    required: true
  is_orphanet_subtype:
    name: is_orphanet_subtype
    annotations:
      attribute_type:
        tag: attribute_type
        value: filter
      curation_type:
        tag: curation_type
        value: manual_mondo
    description: Flag to denote this disease is manually curated to be a disease subtype
      according to Orphanet (https://www.orpha.net/), one of the most important rare
      disease authorities in the world.
    from_schema: https://w3id.org/everycure-org/matrix-schema
    see_also:
    - https://github.com/everycure-org/matrix-disease-list/blob/main/sparql/matrix-disease-list-filters.sparql
    - https://www.orpha.net/
    - https://www.orpha.net/pdfs/orphacom/cahiers/docs/GB/eproc_disease_inventory_R1_Nom_Dis_EP_04.pdf
    rank: 1000
    alias: is_orphanet_subtype
    owner: DiseaseListEntry
    domain_of:
    - DiseaseListEntry
    range: boolean
    required: true
  is_orphanet_subtype_descendant:
    name: is_orphanet_subtype_descendant
    annotations:
      attribute_type:
        tag: attribute_type
        value: filter
      curation_type:
        tag: curation_type
        value: ontology_hierarchy
    description: 'Flag to denote this disease is a child/descendant of a disease that
      is manually curated  to be a disease subtype according to Orphanet (https://www.orpha.net/),
      one of the most  important rare disease authorities in the world. If it is a
      descendant of a subtype, it most likely is a subtype itself.

      '
    from_schema: https://w3id.org/everycure-org/matrix-schema
    see_also:
    - http://dev.everycure.org/schema/is_orphanet_subtype
    - https://github.com/everycure-org/matrix-disease-list/blob/main/sparql/matrix-disease-list-filters.sparql
    rank: 1000
    alias: is_orphanet_subtype_descendant
    owner: DiseaseListEntry
    domain_of:
    - DiseaseListEntry
    range: boolean
    required: true
  is_omimps:
    name: is_omimps
    annotations:
      attribute_type:
        tag: attribute_type
        value: filter
      curation_type:
        tag: curation_type
        value: manual_mondo
    description: 'Flag to denote this disease is manually curated to be a phenotypic
      series according to OMIM (https://www.omim.org/),  one of the most important
      genetic disease authorities in the world.  A Phenotypic Series is a grouping
      of genetic heterogeneity of similar phenotypes across the genome.

      '
    from_schema: https://w3id.org/everycure-org/matrix-schema
    see_also:
    - https://github.com/everycure-org/matrix-disease-list/blob/main/sparql/matrix-disease-list-filters.sparql
    - https://www.omim.org/
    - https://www.omim.org/help/faq#1_14
    rank: 1000
    alias: is_omimps
    owner: DiseaseListEntry
    domain_of:
    - DiseaseListEntry
    range: boolean
    required: true
  is_omimps_descendant:
    name: is_omimps_descendant
    annotations:
      attribute_type:
        tag: attribute_type
        value: filter
      curation_type:
        tag: curation_type
        value: ontology_hierarchy
    description: 'Flag to denote this disease is a child/descendant of a disease that
      is manually curated  to be a phenotypic series according to OMIM (https://www.omim.org/),
      one of the most  important genetic disease authorities in the world. If it is
      a descendant of a phenotypic series, it most likely is a proper genetic disease
      entity (or subtype).

      '
    from_schema: https://w3id.org/everycure-org/matrix-schema
    see_also:
    - https://github.com/everycure-org/matrix-disease-list/blob/main/sparql/matrix-disease-list-filters.sparql
    - https://www.omim.org/
    - https://www.omim.org/help/faq#1_14
    - http://dev.everycure.org/schema/is_omimps
    rank: 1000
    alias: is_omimps_descendant
    owner: DiseaseListEntry
    domain_of:
    - DiseaseListEntry
    range: boolean
    required: true
  is_leaf:
    name: is_leaf
    annotations:
      attribute_type:
        tag: attribute_type
        value: filter
      curation_type:
        tag: curation_type
        value: ontology_hierarchy
    description: 'Flag to denote this disease is a leaf node in the disease hierarchy.  A
      leaf node is a node that has no children in the hierarchy.

      '
    from_schema: https://w3id.org/everycure-org/matrix-schema
    see_also:
    - https://github.com/everycure-org/matrix-disease-list/blob/main/sparql/matrix-disease-list-filters.sparql
    rank: 1000
    alias: is_leaf
    owner: DiseaseListEntry
    domain_of:
    - DiseaseListEntry
    range: boolean
    required: true
  is_leaf_direct_parent:
    name: is_leaf_direct_parent
    annotations:
      attribute_type:
        tag: attribute_type
        value: filter
      curation_type:
        tag: curation_type
        value: ontology_hierarchy
    description: 'Flag to denote this disease is a direct parent of a leaf node in
      the disease hierarchy.  A direct parent of a leaf rarely corresponds to a grouping,
      and often is a proper disease entity.

      '
    from_schema: https://w3id.org/everycure-org/matrix-schema
    see_also:
    - https://github.com/everycure-org/matrix-disease-list/blob/main/sparql/matrix-disease-list-filters.sparql
    rank: 1000
    alias: is_leaf_direct_parent
    owner: DiseaseListEntry
    domain_of:
    - DiseaseListEntry
    range: boolean
    required: true
  is_orphanet_disorder:
    name: is_orphanet_disorder
    annotations:
      attribute_type:
        tag: attribute_type
        value: filter
      curation_type:
        tag: curation_type
        value: manual_mondo
    description: 'Flag to denote this disease is manually curated to be a disease
      according to Orphanet (https://www.orpha.net/),  one of the most important rare
      disease authorities in the world.  A disorder according to Orphanet usually
      corresponds to a proper disease entity, not a grouping or a subtype.

      '
    from_schema: https://w3id.org/everycure-org/matrix-schema
    see_also:
    - https://www.orpha.net/
    - https://www.orpha.net/pdfs/orphacom/cahiers/docs/GB/eproc_disease_inventory_R1_Nom_Dis_EP_04.pdf
    - https://github.com/everycure-org/matrix-disease-list/blob/main/sparql/matrix-disease-list-filters.sparql
    rank: 1000
    alias: is_orphanet_disorder
    owner: DiseaseListEntry
    domain_of:
    - DiseaseListEntry
    range: boolean
    required: true
  is_omim:
    name: is_omim
    annotations:
      attribute_type:
        tag: attribute_type
        value: filter
      curation_type:
        tag: curation_type
        value: manual_mondo
    description: 'Flag to denote this disease is manually curated to be a disease
      according to OMIM (https://www.omim.org/),  one of the most important genetic
      disease authorities in the world.  A disease according to OMIM usually corresponds
      to a proper disease entity or a subtype, not a disease grouping.

      '
    from_schema: https://w3id.org/everycure-org/matrix-schema
    see_also:
    - https://github.com/everycure-org/matrix-disease-list/blob/main/sparql/matrix-disease-list-filters.sparql
    - https://www.omim.org/
    rank: 1000
    alias: is_omim
    owner: DiseaseListEntry
    domain_of:
    - DiseaseListEntry
    range: boolean
    required: true
  is_icd_category:
    name: is_icd_category
    annotations:
      attribute_type:
        tag: attribute_type
        value: filter
      curation_type:
        tag: curation_type
        value: manual_mondo
    description: 'Flag to denote this disease was corresponds to an ICD category.
      Category codes (or subcategory codes), for example A01.1 (Paratyphoid fever
      A),  can be recognised by containing a period (.) character and usually represent
      specific  diagnosable diseases.

      '
    from_schema: https://w3id.org/everycure-org/matrix-schema
    see_also:
    - https://github.com/everycure-org/matrix-disease-list/blob/main/sparql/matrix-disease-list-filters.sparql
    - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ICD-10
    rank: 1000
    alias: is_icd_category
    owner: DiseaseListEntry
    domain_of:
    - DiseaseListEntry
    range: boolean
    required: true
  is_icd_chapter_code:
    name: is_icd_chapter_code
    annotations:
      attribute_type:
        tag: attribute_type
        value: filter
      curation_type:
        tag: curation_type
        value: manual_mondo
    description: 'Flag to denote this disease was corresponds to an ICD chapter code.
      Chapter codes (or block codes), for example A00-B99 (Certain infectious and
      parasitic diseases).  These codes can be recognised by containing a dash (-)
      character, and usually represent broad categories of diseases.

      '
    from_schema: https://w3id.org/everycure-org/matrix-schema
    see_also:
    - https://github.com/everycure-org/matrix-disease-list/blob/main/sparql/matrix-disease-list-filters.sparql
    - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ICD-10
    rank: 1000
    alias: is_icd_chapter_code
    owner: DiseaseListEntry
    domain_of:
    - DiseaseListEntry
    range: boolean
    required: true
  is_icd_chapter_header:
    name: is_icd_chapter_header
    annotations:
      attribute_type:
        tag: attribute_type
        value: filter
      curation_type:
        tag: curation_type
        value: manual_mondo
    description: 'Flag to denote this disease was corresponds to an ICD chapter header.
      Chapter headers (or chapter titles), for example A00 (Cholera) can be identified
      by codes without dashes or periods and are usually the top-level categories
      within each chapter. Most of the time, these are not proper diseases, but groupings
      of diseases.

      '
    from_schema: https://w3id.org/everycure-org/matrix-schema
    see_also:
    - https://github.com/everycure-org/matrix-disease-list/blob/main/sparql/matrix-disease-list-filters.sparql
    - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ICD-10
    rank: 1000
    alias: is_icd_chapter_header
    owner: DiseaseListEntry
    domain_of:
    - DiseaseListEntry
    range: boolean
    required: true
  is_icd_billable:
    name: is_icd_billable
    annotations:
      attribute_type:
        tag: attribute_type
        value: filter
      curation_type:
        tag: curation_type
        value: external_source
    description: 'Flag to denote this disease was corresponds to an ICD code that
      is billable. Billable codes are usually the most specific codes that can be
      used for billing purposes, and are most of the time diagnosable diseases.

      '
    from_schema: https://w3id.org/everycure-org/matrix-schema
    see_also:
    - https://github.com/everycure-org/matrix-disease-list/blob/main/sparql/matrix-disease-list-filters.sparql
    - https://www.cms.gov/files/document/valid-icd-10-list.xlsx
    rank: 1000
    alias: is_icd_billable
    owner: DiseaseListEntry
    domain_of:
    - DiseaseListEntry
    range: boolean
    required: true
  is_mondo_subtype:
    name: is_mondo_subtype
    annotations:
      attribute_type:
        tag: attribute_type
        value: filter
      curation_type:
        tag: curation_type
        value: manual_everycure
    description: 'Flag to denote this disease was identified to be a subtype through
      lexical matching. This method is maintained by the Every Cure medical team and
      the Disease List team.

      '
    from_schema: https://w3id.org/everycure-org/matrix-schema
    see_also:
    - https://github.com/everycure-org/matrix-disease-list/issues/46
    - https://github.com/everycure-org/matrix-disease-list/blob/febc3358a446cc36321ff44ae74064c49011fd5c/scripts/matrix-disease-list.py#L478C5-L478C51
    rank: 1000
    alias: is_mondo_subtype
    owner: DiseaseListEntry
    domain_of:
    - DiseaseListEntry
    range: boolean
    required: true
  is_pathway_defect:
    name: is_pathway_defect
    annotations:
      attribute_type:
        tag: attribute_type
        value: filter
      curation_type:
        tag: curation_type
        value: manual_everycure
    description: 'Flag to denote this disease corresponds to a pathway defect rather
      than a proper disease.

      '
    from_schema: https://w3id.org/everycure-org/matrix-schema
    see_also:
    - https://github.com/everycure-org/matrix-disease-list/issues/51
    - https://github.com/everycure-org/matrix-disease-list/blob/main/src/excluded-diseases.robot.tsv
    rank: 1000
    alias: is_pathway_defect
    owner: DiseaseListEntry
    domain_of:
    - DiseaseListEntry
    range: boolean
    required: true
  is_susceptibility:
    name: is_susceptibility
    annotations:
      attribute_type:
        tag: attribute_type
        value: filter
      curation_type:
        tag: curation_type
        value: lexical_matching
    description: 'Flag to denote this disease corresponds to a susceptibility rather
      than a proper disease.

      '

docs.title: Schema Source

docs.title: LinkML Source
docs.text:
name: KnowledgeLevelEnum
from_schema: https://w3id.org/everycure-org/matrix-schema
rank: 1000
permissible_values:
  knowledge_assertion:
    text: knowledge_assertion
    description: A statement of purported fact that is put forth by an agent as true,
      based on assessment of direct evidence. Assertions are likely but not  definitively
      true.
    notes:
    - Knowledge Assertions are supported by direct evidence deemed sufficient by some
      agent to support a confidence assertion of truth. Our certainty  in this truth
      is not absolute, but is typically higher than for Predictions.
    aliases:
    - assertion
  logical_entailment:
    text: logical_entailment
    description: A statement reporting a conclusion that follows logically from premises
      representing established facts or knowledge assertions (e.g. fingernail part
      of finger, finger part of hand --> fingernail part of hand).
    notes:
    - These statements report entailed conclusions derived through dedictive inference.
      They are not directly asserted by a source, but logically follow from statement(s)  a
      source does make - and are necessarily true if their supporting premises are
      true.  In practice, these will primarily be entailments based on logic encoded
      in ontologies.  Examples include propagation of annotated knowledge to hierarchically-related
      concepts, across paths through a graph constructed from transitive relationships,
      or sets of  relationships that support property chain inference.
    aliases:
    - deductive_inference
  prediction:
    text: prediction
    description: A statement of a possible fact based on probabilistic forms of reasoning
      over more indirect forms of evidence, that lead to more speculative conclusions.
    notes:
    - Predictions typically result from non-deductive forms of reasoning - e.g. inductive
      and deductive inference, or statistical inference where conclusions are drawn
      about a broader/global population based on data from a representative cohort.
      For example, a prediction that a drug may treat a particular disease based on
      its chemical similarity to known drugs that treat the disease, and the fact
      that it can inhibit proteins  in a pathway that is associated with the disease
      As Predictions are based on weaker forms of inference and evidence, they are
      typically  considered lower confidence statements as compared to Knowledge Assertions
      and Logical Entailments.
    aliases:
    - hypothesis
  statistical_association:
    text: statistical_association
    description: A statement that reports concepts representing variables in a dataset
      to be statistically associated with each other in a particular cohort (e.g.
      'Metformin Treatment (variable 1) is correlated with Diabetes Diagnosis (variable
      2) in EHR dataset X').
    notes:
    - Such statements report the direct results of some statistical analysis. Their
      scope is limited tp the cohort/dataset interrogated in the analysis, and they
      do not make broader claims or draw  more meaningful conclusions about the domain
      of discourse. Note however that such Statistical  Associations can be used as
      evidence to support a more pointed/precise Prediction or Assertion  of knowledge.
      For example, e.g. a Statistical Association between 'Metformin Prescription'
      and 'Diabetes Diagnosis' in EHR records could support a Prediction that 'Metformin
      treats Diabetes',  or 'Metformin causes Diabetes'. This 'treats' edge may have
      a knowledge_level of 'Prediction',  but the provider could use the 'evidence_type'
      edge property to indicate that this prediction is  based on a 'Statistical Association'.
      Because Statistical Associations directly report analysis-specific  results,
      we can consider them to be inherently true statements, whose broader utility
      is dependent on  subsequent generalization of the reported result to a broader
      population, and/or interpretation of the  result as support for a more meaningful
      statements about the domain of discourse.
  observation:
    text: observation
    description: A statement reporting (and possibly quantifying) a phenomenon that
      was observed to occur -  absent any analysis or interpretation that generates
      a statistical association or supports a broader conclusion or inference.
    notes:
    - An observation that "56362 people self-reported taking melatonin to treat migraines"
      is agnostic to whether melatonin is an effective or approved treatment - it
      only claims that it was taken for this purpose. Such observations, however,
      may be used as the basis for predicting that a  drug may be efficacious against
      a disease.
  not_provided:
    text: not_provided
    description: The knowledge level is not provided, typically because it cannot
      be determined from available. information.
    notes:
    - This term is most often applied for text-mined edges, as NLP tools are typically
      not able to detect a specific knowledge level for the concept relationships
      they extract (e.g. whether the author  was predicting or asserting a relationship,
      or merely observed it to occur).

docs.title: Type: Sparqlpath
docs.text:
A string encoding a SPARQL Property Path. The value of the string MUST conform to SPARQL syntax and SHOULD dereference to zero or more valid objects within the current instance document when encoded as RDF.

URI: xsd:string

  • base: str

  • uri: xsd:string

  • repr: str

docs.title: anatomical
docs.text:
URI: matrix_schema:anatomical

Applicable to: DiseaseListEntry

Description

Tag to denote this disease to be part of a grouping according to the anatomical location. Disease terms are automatically tagged using an LLM. Problems/issues should be reported on the Matrix disease list issue tracker (https://github.com/everycure-org/matrix-disease-list/issues). __

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
• Range: String. The range of the element is the type of the value that can be assigned to it.
  • Multivalued: True. If the element is multivalued, more than one value can be attached to the same field. In the TSV format, these are | separated.
  • Required?: Optional

docs.title: Schema developer documentation
docs.text:
LinkML source 
name: anatomical
annotations:
  attribute_type:
    tag: attribute_type
    value: grouping
  curation_type:
    tag: curation_type
    value: llm
description: 'Tag to denote this disease to be part of a grouping according to the
  anatomical location. Disease terms are automatically tagged using an LLM. Problems/issues
  should be reported on the Matrix disease list issue  tracker (https://github.com/everycure-org/matrix-disease-list/issues).

  '
from_schema: https://w3id.org/everycure-org/matrix-schema
rank: 1000
alias: anatomical
domain_of:
- DiseaseListEntry
range: string
multivalued: true
inlined: true
inlined_as_list: true

docs.title: harrisons_view
docs.text:
URI: matrix_schema:harrisons_view

Applicable to: DiseaseListEntry

Description

Tag to denote this disease to be part of a grouping according to the Harrison's textbook. Top-level classes in Mondo are manually curated by the Mondo team to "belong" to a Harrison's textbook chapter. Disagreements should be reported on the Mondo issue tracker (https://github.com/monarch-initiative/mondo/issues). __

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
• Range: String. The range of the element is the type of the value that can be assigned to it.
  • Multivalued: True. If the element is multivalued, more than one value can be attached to the same field. In the TSV format, these are | separated.
  • Required?: Optional

  • https://accessmedicine.mhmedical.com/book.aspx?bookID=3095

  Harrison''s textbook. Top-level classes in Mondo are manually curated by the Mondo
  team to "belong" to a Harrison''s textbook chapter. Disagreements should be reported
  on the Mondo issue tracker (https://github.com/monarch-initiative/mondo/issues).

  '

Applicable to: DiseaseListEntry

Description

Flag to denote this disease corresponds to an acquired form of a disease. __

• Range: Boolean. The range of the element is the type of the value that can be assigned to it.

docs.title: is_cancer
docs.text:
URI: matrix_schema:is_cancer

Applicable to: DiseaseListEntry

Description

Flag to denote if this disease corresponds to a cancer type. Disease classes are automatically flagged using an LLM. Problems/issues should be reported on the Matrix disease list issue tracker (https://github.com/everycure-org/matrix-disease-list/issues). __

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
• Range: Boolean. The range of the element is the type of the value that can be assigned to it.

  • Required?: Optional

  attribute_type:
    tag: attribute_type
    value: filter
  curation_type:
    tag: curation_type
    value: llm
description: 'Flag to denote if this disease corresponds to a cancer type. Disease
  classes are automatically flagged using an LLM. Problems/issues should be reported
  on the Matrix disease list issue  tracker (https://github.com/everycure-org/matrix-disease-list/issues).

  '
from_schema: https://w3id.org/everycure-org/matrix-schema
rank: 1000

domain_of:
- DiseaseListEntry

docs.title: is_clingen
docs.text:
URI: matrix_schema:is_clingen

Applicable to: DiseaseListEntry

Description

Flag to denote that this disease term is used directly by https://clinicalgenome.org/ (a major authority on genetic diseases), which is a strong indication that it corresponds to a real disease entity.

docs.title: Properties

  • https://clinicalgenome.org/

docs.title: is_icd_billable
docs.text:
URI: matrix_schema:is_icd_billable

Applicable to: DiseaseListEntry

Description

Flag to denote this disease was corresponds to an ICD code that is billable. Billable codes are usually the most specific codes that can be used for billing purposes, and are most of the time diagnosable diseases. __

  • https://www.cms.gov/files/document/valid-icd-10-list.xlsx

URI: matrix_schema:is_icd_category

Applicable to: DiseaseListEntry

Description

Flag to denote this disease was corresponds to an ICD category. Category codes (or subcategory codes), for example A01.1 (Paratyphoid fever A), can be recognised by containing a period (.) character and usually represent specific diagnosable diseases. __

  • https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ICD-10

docs.title: is_icd_chapter_code
docs.text:
URI: matrix_schema:is_icd_chapter_code

Applicable to: DiseaseListEntry

Description

Flag to denote this disease was corresponds to an ICD chapter code. Chapter codes (or block codes), for example A00-B99 (Certain infectious and parasitic diseases). These codes can be recognised by containing a dash (-) character, and usually represent broad categories of diseases. __

  • Required?: Optional

  • https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ICD-10

docs.title: is_icd_chapter_header
docs.text:
URI: matrix_schema:is_icd_chapter_header

Applicable to: DiseaseListEntry

Description

Flag to denote this disease was corresponds to an ICD chapter header. Chapter headers (or chapter titles), for example A00 (Cholera) can be identified by codes without dashes or periods and are usually the top-level categories within each chapter. Most of the time, these are not proper diseases, but groupings of diseases. __

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
• Range: Boolean. The range of the element is the type of the value that can be assigned to it.

  • Required?: Optional

  • https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ICD-10

Description

Flag to denote this disease is manually curated to be a disease according to OMIM (https://www.omim.org/), one of the most important genetic disease authorities in the world. A disease according to OMIM usually corresponds to a proper disease entity or a subtype, not a disease grouping. __

docs.title: official_matrix_filter
docs.text:
URI: matrix_schema:official_matrix_filter

Applicable to: DiseaseListEntry

Description

Flag to denote this disease corresponds to a disease that can be treated with small molecules or biologics. This flag is maintained as a combination of default filters by the Matrix team. Changes to this filter should be discussed on the Matrix disease list issue tracker (https://github.com/everycure-org/matrix-disease-list/issues). Warning. This flag is in early alpha state, and its use in production systems is not recommended. __

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
• Range: Boolean. The range of the element is the type of the value that can be assigned to it.

  • Required?: Optional

docs.title: Schema developer documentation
docs.text:
LinkML source 
name: official_matrix_filter
annotations:
  annotations:
    tag: annotations
  attribute_type:
    tag: attribute_type
    value: filter
  curation_type:
    tag: curation_type
    value: manual_everycure
description: 'Flag to denote this disease corresponds to a disease that can be treated
  with small molecules or biologics. This flag is maintained as a combination of default
  filters by the Matrix team. Changes to this filter should be discussed on the Matrix
  disease list issue tracker (https://github.com/everycure-org/matrix-disease-list/issues).
  **Warning**. This flag is in early alpha state, and its use in production systems
  is not recommended.

  '
from_schema: https://w3id.org/everycure-org/matrix-schema
rank: 1000
alias: official_matrix_filter
domain_of:
- DiseaseListEntry
range: boolean

docs.title: tag_existing_treatment
docs.text:
URI: matrix_schema:tag_existing_treatment

Applicable to: DiseaseListEntry

Description

Flag to denote if this disease has some existing treatment. Disease classes are automatically flagged using an LLM. Problems/issues should be reported on the Matrix disease list issue tracker (https://github.com/everycure-org/matrix-disease-list/issues). __

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:

  • Required?: Optional

  curation_type:

    value: llm

  classes are automatically flagged using an LLM. Problems/issues should be reported
  on the Matrix disease list issue  tracker (https://github.com/everycure-org/matrix-disease-list/issues).

  '

rank: 1000

- DiseaseListEntry

docs.title: tag_qaly_lost
docs.text:
URI: matrix_schema:tag_qaly_lost

Applicable to: DiseaseListEntry

Description

Tag denoting the degree to which Quality-Adjusted Life Year (QALY) lost. Disease terms are automatically tagged using an LLM. Problems/issues should be reported on the Matrix disease list issue tracker (https://github.com/everycure-org/matrix-disease-list/issues). __

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
• Range: String. The range of the element is the type of the value that can be assigned to it.

  • Required?: Required Regex pattern*: ^(low|medium|high|very_high|none)$

docs.title: Schema developer documentation
docs.text:

annotations:
  curation_type:
    tag: curation_type
    value: llm
description: 'Tag denoting the degree to which Quality-Adjusted Life Year (QALY) lost.
  Disease terms are automatically tagged using an LLM. Problems/issues should be reported
  on the Matrix disease list issue  tracker (https://github.com/everycure-org/matrix-disease-list/issues).

  '
from_schema: https://w3id.org/everycure-org/matrix-schema
rank: 1000
alias: tag_qaly_lost
domain_of:
- DiseaseListEntry
range: string
required: true
pattern: ^(low|medium|high|very_high|none)$

docs.title: txgnn
docs.text:
URI: matrix_schema:txgnn

Applicable to: DiseaseListEntry

Description

Tag this disease to be part of a grouping as defined by the txgnn paper. Disease classes in Mondo are automatically assigned to a txgnn category using an LLM. Problems/issues should be reported on the Matrix disease list issue tracker (https://github.com/everycure-org/matrix-disease-list/issues). __

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
• Range: String. The range of the element is the type of the value that can be assigned to it.
  • Multivalued: True. If the element is multivalued, more than one value can be attached to the same field. In the TSV format, these are | separated.
  • Required?: Optional

docs.title: See Also
docs.text:
These are some relevant resources you might find useful to get additional information about the element, such as example implementations, external websites, issues and pull requests.

  • https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC11645266/

  Disease classes in Mondo are automatically assigned to a txgnn category using an
  LLM. Problems/issues should be reported on the Matrix disease list issue  tracker
  (https://github.com/everycure-org/matrix-disease-list/issues).

  '

- DiseaseListEntry
